comment.author: 51043085@N08
comment._content: Hello! What amazing photos! We'd love you to share them on our site, www.historypin.com. Historypin is a digital time machine that creates a new way for the world to see and share history. It was created by We Are What We Do, in partnership with Google. You can overlay your photos on Google Streetview and compare your photo to what it looks like now. www.youtube.com/historypin

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
olga s: Thanks for posting this fresh picture! :-) It's so interesting to compare... A lot has changed, and the school is gone and replaced by a new building. 

Historypin: You're indeed welcome to share our pictures on historypin! Seems as an amazing site for historical photographs. :-)

/Anna B.

comment.author: 45621760@N00
comment._content: The school is still there - it's the second, bigger building to the right! :) I don't know what the small house was, probably just a residential house. It was replaced in 1913 by the house you can see on the new photo. Here you can see the facade of the school building today: kartor.eniro.se/m/pivg7

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
olga s: You have really enlightened us about this school building. :) "Anna och Eva Bunths skola för flickor" according to the facade picture you linked to. ("Anna and Eva Bunth's school for girls.") Just wonderful!
/Anna B.
